alert.note: Alert for Benton; Gibson; Henry; Weakley (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 13 at 4:27PM CDT until April 13 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Weakley County in western Tennessee... Northeastern Gibson County in western Tennessee... North central Benton County in western Tennessee... Henry County in western Tennessee... * Until 500 PM CDT. * At 425 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Lynnville to near Dresden to Greenfield, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Paris, McKenzie, Paris Landing State Park, Dresden, Greenfield, Gleason, Bradford, Cottage Grove, Routon, Palmersville, Springville, Puryear, Henry, Sandhill, Jones Mill, Old Springville, Crossland, Como, Brundige and Staffords Store. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for western Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for western Tennessee.
